question_text: A technician is installing a PCIe x4 card, but the motherboard has only a PCIe x16 slot available. What should they do?
answer_options: Use a PCIe x1 slot instead
Only install x4 cards in x4 slots
Install it in the x16 slot — it will work
Install it into a PCI slot
correct_answer: Install it in the x16 slot — it will work
explanation: PCIe is backward compatible by lane size. A x4 card can be installed in a x16 slot — unused lanes are simply ignored.
